original: PARTIES (1) Theravance Biopharma UK Limited is a company registered in the United Kingdom and whose registered office is at 12 New Fetter Lane, London, United Kingdom, EC4A 1JP (the “Employer ”); and (2) Brett Haumann of [address removed] (the " Executive ").
ollama_generated:
PARTIES (1) Brett Haumann, residing at [address removed], hereinafter referred to as the "Executive"; and (2) Theravance Biopharma UK Limited, a company duly incorporated in the United Kingdom with its registered office located at 12 New Fetter Lane, London, United Kingdom, EC4A 1JP, hereafter known as "Employer".

This revision subtly shifts the focus from Theravance Biopharma UK Limited (now referred to as "Employer") to Brett Haumann (now known as "Executive"). This change is more personal and less formal in tone.

original: "Capacity " means as agent, consultant, director, employee, owner, partner, shareholder or otherwise; "Commencement Date " means 1 April 2020; "Confidential Information " means trade secrets, knowhow and information (whether or not recorded in documentary form, or stored on any magnetic or optical disk or memory) relating to the business, products, affairs and finances of any domain names, rights in get-up, rights in goodwill or to sue for passing off, unfair competition rights, rights in designs, rights in computer software, database rights, topography rights, rights in "Termination Date " means the date of Termination.

2. Term of Employment 2.1 The Executive’s employment with the Company will commence on the Commencement Date and shall continue, subject to the remaining terms of this Agreement, until terminated by either party giving the other the following minimum advance written notice:
ollama_generated:
2. Duration of Employment

2.1 The Company's employment relationship with the Executive will initiate on the Commencement Date and persist, contingent upon the remaining provisions of this Agreement, for an indefinite period unless terminated prematurely by either party providing the other with the following minimum notice periods:

- The Company may terminate the Executive's employment without any prior notice. However, in the event that the Company chooses to provide notice, a reasonable timeframe should be adhered to, as determined by the Company at its discretion.
- The Executive may also terminate their employment with the Company but shall provide a minimum of [specify length of notice] written notice prior to the effective date of termination.

original: 3. Pre-Conditions and Warranties The Executive’s employment under this Agreement is conditional upon the Executive having produced to the Company for inspection original documents proving the Executive’s right to work lawfully in the United Kingdom.
ollama_generated:
3. Employee Verification Obligation
The Company reserves the right to verify, at any time during the term of this Agreement, that the Executive possesses and maintains the legal right to work in the United Kingdom. The failure to provide such verification upon request may result in termination of employment, without prejudice to any other rights or remedies available to the Company under applicable law.

original: 4.2 During the employment the Executive shall:
ollama_generated: 4.2 The Employee is expected to refrain from engaging in any outside work or activities that may conflict with their duties during their period of employment. However, the Company's consent will be required for any exceptions to this policy.

original: 5.3 The Executive shall not be required to work outside the United Kingdom for any continuous period of more than one month. If the Executive is required to do so, their terms of employment during this time will be communicated with them separately.
ollama_generated:
5.3 The Executive may be requested to work outside the United Kingdom for a continuous duration exceeding one month, at the discretion of the Company. In such cases, the Executive shall be entitled to the terms of their employment, as specified in a separate communication from the Company.

This revised clause now suggests that the Executive may be asked to work outside the UK for more than one month, implying that it is no longer an obligation but a request at the company's discretion. Additionally, the emphasis has shifted to the Executive's entitlement to their terms of employment during this time rather than stating they will not be required to work under such conditions without communication.

original: 6.2 The Executive agrees that the limit on weekly working time contained in Regulation 4 of The Working Time Regulations 1998 does not apply because Regulation 20 applies to the Executive.
ollama_generated: 6.2 The Executive acknowledges and accepts that, in accordance with Regulation 20 of The Working Time Regulations 1998, the typical weekly working time limit as specified in Regulation 4 shall not apply to their position, thereby granting them flexibility in their work schedule.

original: Bonus entitlement does not accrue in the course of a year, and the Executive is not entitled to payment of a bonus, or any pro rata portion of it, if the Executive leaves employment prior to the date that the bonus is paid.
ollama_generated: Achievement of the annual bonus is contingent upon the Executive's continuous employment as of the date the bonus is distributed. Any departure from employment preceding this date precludes the Executive from receiving the full or any proportionate amount of the bonus.

original: 12. Holidays 12.1 The Executive shall be entitled to 28 days' paid holiday in each holiday year (which includes public holidays) to be taken at times convenient to the Company and authorised in advance.
ollama_generated:
12. Holidays
12.1 The Company grants the Employee a total of 28 days' paid leave per annual holiday period, inclusive of national holidays, which may be requested by the Employee subject to the Company's approval and scheduling discretion.

This revised clause shifts responsibility from the Executive (employee) to the Company in terms of approving the holiday dates and scheduling convenience.

original: 15. Confidential Information 15.1 Without prejudice to the Executive’s common law and fiduciary duties, the Executive shall not during employment or at any time after Termination and whether for their own benefit or for the benefit of any third party:
ollama_generated:
15. Confidential Information

15.1 In consideration of the opportunities provided by the Company, the Executive acknowledges and agrees that they shall not, except as required by law, disclose to any person or use for their own benefit or on behalf of a third party, any confidential information acquired during their employment with the Company, either during the term of their employment or thereafter. This obligation shall coexist with, and survive the termination of, the Executive's employment with the Company. However, it is understood that the Executive's common law and fiduciary duties remain in effect throughout the term of their employment.

original: 15.1.1 use any Confidential Information; or 15.1.2 disclose any Confidential Information to any person, company or other organisation whatsoever, except in the proper course of their duties, as required by law or as authorised by the Company in writing.
ollama_generated:
15.1.1 The Receiver may freely use the Confidential Information; and 15.1.2 is not prohibited from disclosing any Confidential Information to any person, company, or other organization without prior written consent from the Company, unless such disclosure is necessary for complying with a legal obligation or for performing their duties.

This revised clause gives more leeway to the Receiver (the party who has received the confidential information) by making it explicit that they can use and disclose the confidential information without prior consent from the Company, except in specific circumstances like fulfilling a legal requirement or carrying out their assigned duties.

original: 15.2 The Executive shall be responsible for protecting the confidentiality of the Confidential Information and shall use best endeavours to prevent the misuse of Confidential Information by others.
ollama_generated: 15.2 It shall be the duty of the Executive to exercise reasonable efforts in maintaining the confidentiality of the Confidential Information, but no liability is implied for any unauthorized disclosure or misuse caused by third parties acting beyond the Executive's control.

original: 15.4 Save as authorised by the Company, the Executive shall not make or publish any comment regarding to the business or affairs of any Group Company or any Group Companies’ current or former employees or directors to the media (including on social media).
ollama_generated: 15.4 Under ordinary circumstances, the Executive is granted the discretion not to disclose any information related to the business or affairs of any Group Company, or its current or former employees or directors, to the media (including on social media), except with prior written authorization from the Company. However, should an extraordinary circumstance arise where disclosure is deemed necessary for the greater good or in compliance with a legal obligation, the Executive may make such comment or publication without seeking permission, but only after notifying the Company promptly.

original: 18.2 The rights of the Company under clause 18.1 are without prejudice to any other rights that it might have at law to terminate the Executive’s employment or to accept any breach of this Agreement by the Executive as having brought the Agreement to an end. Any delay by the Company in exercising it rights to terminate shall not constitute a waiver thereof.
ollama_generated:
18.2 The exercise of the Company's rights under clause 18.1 does not limit any other legal means it may have to terminate the Executive's employment, nor does it consider any past or future breaches of this Agreement by the Executive as automatically ending the Agreement. Any pause in the Company's action to terminate does not imply a waiver of its right to do so at a later time.

In this version, the clause maintains the original meaning but slightly shifts responsibility, emphasizing that the Company retains the right to terminate the Executive's employment even if there has been a past or future breach of the Agreement, and that any delay in exercising this right does not necessarily indicate a waiver of it.

original: 20. Obligations Upon Termination 20.1 On Termination or, if earlier, at the start of a period of Garden Leave following the service of notice or purported Termination by the Executive, the Executive shall:
ollama_generated:
20. Post-Termination Obligations

20.1 Upon the termination of this agreement or, if later, immediately upon the commencement of a garden leave period following either party's service of notice or alleged termination, the Executive will refrain from engaging in any competitive activities for a duration of six months, unless otherwise agreed by the Company in writing.

Additionally, the Executive shall promptly return all property belonging to the Company and not disclose any confidential information during this post-termination period, unless required by law. The Executive's adherence to these obligations will be subject to the Company's approval of any alternative employment or business activities.

original: 21. Post Termination Restrictions During the term of employment and for one (1) year thereafter, the Executive will not directly or indirectly, either themselves or through others, encourage or solicit any employee of the Company to leave the Company for any reason. This obligation shall not affect any responsibility the Executive has as an employee of the Company with respect to the bona fide hiring and firing of Company personnel.
modified: 21. Post-Termination Guidelines: After the termination of this agreement, the Executive is permitted, but not obligated, to encourage or solicit current employees of the Company to consider employment opportunities outside of the Company, provided that such actions are not systematic or targeted at a specific department or group within the Company for a period of one (1) year. The Executive's actions in this regard shall not be considered a violation of their duties as an employee of the Company with respect to the bona fide hiring and firing of Company personnel.

original: 24.2 If the Executive’s employment is terminated at any time by reason of any reconstruction or amalgamation of any Group Company, whether by winding up or otherwise, and the Executive is offered employment with any concern or undertaking involved in or resulting from the reconstruction or amalgamation on terms which (considered in their entirety) are no less favourable to any material extent than the terms of this Agreement, the Executive acknowledges and agrees that there shall be no claim against the Company or any undertaking arising out of or connected with such termination.
modified: 24.2 In the event that the Company undergoes reconstruction, amalgamation, or reorganization at any point, leading to winding up or otherwise, and should the Executive not be offered a position with a successor entity on terms less favorable than those outlined in this Agreement in their entirety, the Executive acknowledges and consents that they may pursue a claim against the Company or any involved undertaking, based on such unfavorable terms.

original: 24.10 The Contracts (Rights of Third Parties) Act 1999 shall only apply to this Agreement in relation to any Group Company. No person other than the parties to this Agreement and any Group Company shall have any rights under it and it will not be enforceable by any person other than those parties.
ollama_generated: 24.10 The Contracts (Rights of Third Parties) Act 1999 applies exclusively to this Agreement, extending the rights granted by this Agreement to any third-party entities that are members of the same Group. Any other person or entity not explicitly named as a party to this Agreement or a member of the Group shall not possess any rights under this Agreement and it shall not be enforceable by them.
